name: Peg Transfer
instructions: Timing begins when first object is touched. Timing ends upon release of last object.
Pick up each object using grasper in non-dominant hand.
Transfer the object mid-air to dominant hand.
Place the object onto a peg on the opposite peg side of the pegboard, switching patterns. There is no importance for color or order of transfer.
Repeat until all objects have been transferred to opposite side of the board.
When all 6 objects have been moved, reverse the process, starting with dominant hand and transferring to non-dominant hand.
penalties: Dropping an object outside the field of view
Instrument leaving the field of view

evaluationQuestions.question: Did you drop a peg outside field of view?
Did your instrument leave the field of view?

name: Pattern Cut
instructions: Timing begins when gauze is touched. Timing ends when marked circle is completely cut from gauze.
Provide traction to gauze using Maryland dissector in either hand
Use scissors in other hand to cut into the gauze and in between training circles drawn on gauze until it is completely removed.
Only top layer needs to be cut. Bottom layers of multi-ply gauze can be cut as much or as little as desired.
Gauze cannot be reaffixed to clip if pulled out during task.
penalties: Cutting into or outside training lines drawn on gauze

evaluationQuestions.question: Did you cut outside the training lines?

name: Ligating Loop
instructions: Timing when instrument or loop is visible. Timing ends when end of loop material is cut.
Using the grasper or Maryland dissector in one hand and the pre-tied ligating loop in the other, position the loop around the marked target on the appendage of the foam organ.
Break off the end of the plastic pusher at the mark and secure the knot by sliding the pusher rod down, within 1 mm of the mark.
Introduce the scissors and cut the end of the loop material. For practicing, you may simulate cutting the loop to save resources.
penalties: Loop not secured fully around the appendage
Loop > 1 mm away from mark on appendage

evaluationQuestions.question: Is the loop securely on the appendage?
Is the loop < 1 mm away from the mark on the appendage?

name: Extracorporeal Suture
instructions: Timing of this task begins when first instrument is visible. Timing ends when you have cut both ends of the suture.
Use a needle driver to grasp the thread and introduce the suture into the device.
Using two needle drivers, place a long suture through the two marks on the penrose drain, within 1 mm of the marks.
Tie 3 single throws of a knot extracorporeally using a knot pusher to secure each throw, closing the slit.
Exchange one tool with scissors and cut both ends of the suture.
penalties: Slit in drain is not closed
Suture is > 1 mm away from marks
Drain is pulled off foam block

evaluationQuestions.question: Is the suture < 1 mm away from the dots on the drain?
Did you pull the drain off the foam block?
